settings.heading: Dumais Made is a pottery studio based in Litchfield, Connecticut, specializing in handmade lamps and accessories.Founded by Charlie and Kevin Dumais in 2017, Dumais Made is a labor of love, a collaboration, reflecting their shared experience and interests. The studio began as a hobby, a small series of lamps conceived together and produced by Charlie outside his work as a lighting designer. Inspired by modernist sculpture, these simple, straightforward pieces, rendered in muted colors and natural textures, allowed the pair to experiment with how we interact with light. And, importantly, to better understand how we live with it.These initial lamps are still a part of Charlie and Kevin’s life. One sits on a nightstand in their house in Litchfield, another on a desk in Kevin’s interior design practice in New York. As the studio has grown and evolved – it now produces lamps, pendants, sconces and accessories of all sizes that have found their way into homes, offices and other spaces around the country – these pieces have continued to inform the pair’s output: tactile objects that reveal their character the longer you live with them.

settings.text: We make lamps because we love interacting with light: the waning sun, the flip of a switch, the warm pool that floods a room. Whether that interaction is with a lamp, pendant, sconce or even a candle, it's part of a daily ritual, which is why we believe these pieces are an essential aspect of any room.

settings.caption: How we work, as illustrated by Charlie

settings.text:
1. 
Our inspiration comes from far and wide. It can be found in the natural flora and fauna around our studio in Litchfield, which is serene and sometimes surprising.

  Or in the product of human hands, like the shapes and forms of the mid-century – we're particular fans of Jean-Michel Frank – or objects from unknown craftsmen. Dumais Made began because of antique Japanese lamp.

2. 
Clay is a natural material, which means each of our pieces is individual. Even a pair of lamps, while made from the same template, possess their own expression.

Their surfaces and seams are subtly different.  Their shapes quietly distinct. It's   natural individuality, one that is respectfully enhanced through our hands.

3. 
Our pieces are finished with the finest glazes. We’re drawn to depth and contrast found in the environment around us – the way nature layers colors, for instance. Or the way gilding can maximize the quality of light, both natural and artificial.
